body.p: Born on January 8, 1825 in Harrison County, Kentucky. Attended Bacon College in Harrodsburg, Kentucky where he graduated valedictorian in 1846. Enlisted in the Amry to fight in the Mexican American War. Served as a commissioned sergeant in Company C, Second Kentucky Regiments under the command of Colonel McKee. Withers was wounded at the battle of Buena Vista. He stayed three months in a hospital and was then transported to Kentucky by ambulance. He then studied law under William R. Wall. Withers passed the bar and began practicing law in Cynthiana, Kentucky until 1851 when he moved to Jackson, Mississippi. Married Martha Sharkey, in 1850. Purchased land in Louisiana and began a cotton plantation there. At the outbreak of the Civil War, Withers sided with the Confederate States of America and upon the request of Jefferson Davis, traveled to Kentucky to raise the 1st Kentucky Brigade at Camp Boone in Tennessee. During the war, he was promoted to the rank of Colonel. Withers fought in the battle of Vicksburg, being put in command of the Confederate right wing. He fought in other battles as well including, Champion Hill, the siege of Vicksburg, and Mobile Bay. He surrendered with the troops under his command in Macon, Georgia. He died from his Mexican American war wounds on June 16, 1889 in Fayette County, Kentucky.
